page.title: 01Where We Live
page.content: Our area is very rural.It contains the parish churches of St.Michael'at Cheriton,All Saint's at Hinton Ampner and St.Andrew's at Kilmeston. It is high down country,chalk and clay,sloping towards the village of Cheriton which lies in the river valley of the River Itchen, the source of which is just south of the village. Cheriton is a well kept village that has won the Best Kept Village in Hampshire award on several occasions. There are many thatched and half timbered cottages in the area and much flint work can be seen. Farming is mixed,wheat and barley being the main crops, with dairy herds,beef cattle and sheep.
